text: The whiskey smash (also called bourbon smash) is a citrus smash with bourbon whiskey, muddled lemon wedges, simple syrup, and (optionally) muddled mint leaves. In 1887, it appeared in Jerry Thomas' "Bar-Tenders Guide." The whiskey smash can also be made with gin, vodka, or rum. The bourbon smash can also be made with maple syrup and fresh sage leaves in place of the simple syrup and mint respectively. ==References== Category:Citrus cocktails Category:Cocktails with whisky Category:Sour cocktails Category:Sweet cocktails
